Key Arguments: The submission expresses strong opposition to further government control of information.
The author believes that the government has already overreached in its powers and control over citizens' lives.
The submission suggests that a democratic approach encouraging debate is preferable to government control of conversations.
The author is skeptical about a government department determining what constitutes truth and misinformation.
Notable Quotes: I have so many grave concerns for any further government control of information, that I can not find sufficient words for how much I oppose this bill.
One can't help feeling that such a response is somewhat tyrannical and wise to avoid, should the past be anything to go by.
As to giving any one government department the right to be the ones to determine what is truth and what is 'misinformation' has got to be some crazy joke on the Australian population.
